	A batch of us just had the same problem here when running tests
through an Ant script. The problem seems to have been caused by having two
different versions of the JUnit jar in the classpath (ours was once in our
system classpath, and once specified in the Ant classpath). Check your
classpaths and ensure that you don't have multiple references to junit.jar
in there. 

	-tim

-----Original Message-----
From: Durham David Cntr 805CSS/SCBE [mailto:David.Durham1@...]
Sent: Thursday, November 14, 2002 10:07 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] problem with assert equals


I am making an assertion in a test script and it is throwing an error.  I
know that the arguments that I am passing into the assertion are valid
String objects.

Here's the error:

	Caused an ERROR
junit.framework.Assert.assertEquals(Ljava/lang/String;Ljava/lang/String;)V
	at
mil.usaf.rad.course.tests.CourseFactoryTest.testCreateSection(Unknown
Source)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at
sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39
)
	at
sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl
.java:25)
	at
org.netbeans.core.execution.RunClassThread.run(RunClassThread.java:119)


Here's the code:

    public void testCreateSection() throws Exception {
        Section section = CourseFactory.newSection();
	  section.setCourse(course);
        section.setName("section");
        section.setAccountRequired(false);
        section.save();

        Section section2 = CourseFactory.getSection(section.getSectionID());

        //System.err.println("section2 name: " + section2.getName());
        //System.err.println("section name: " + section.getName());
>>      assertEquals(section.getName(), section2.getName());     // throws
the error
        assertEquals(section.getCourse(), section2.getCourse());  // if I
comment the line above, then this line will run just fine.
        assertEquals(section.getAccountRequired(),
section2.getAccountRequired());
    }


If I uncomment the System.err lines then I see that both of these objects
have the name "section" which is what I want, but for some reason the call
to assertEquals will throw the error above.


Does anyone know what would or could be causing this?



Thanks,

Dave
